section.heading: When to render accounts; supervised administration.

para.heading: General. —
para.text: Except as provided in section 20-731, a supervised personal representative shall render accounts:
within one year and one day of the first publication of notice pursuant to section 20-704;

within 9 months after the account referred to in paragraph (1) of this subsection and within 9 months of each subsequent account until the filing of the final account or the termination of the supervised personal representative’s appointment;
upon termination of the supervised personal representative’s appointment, as provided in subchapter III of Chapter 5; and
at such other times as may be ordered by the Court.

para.heading: Extensions. —
para.text: Upon written application of the supervised personal representative stating reasons for the request, the Court may, for good cause shown, extend the time for rendering an account to a specified date.

annotations.annotation: Application of Law 10-241: See Application of Law 10-241 and Emergency act amendment notes to § 20-701.01.
